title: Oscar-nominated actress Diahann Carroll dies aged 84
text:
Diahann Carroll has died aged 84 (Picture: Cheriss May/NurPhoto via Getty Images)

Actress Diahann Carroll, known for starring in Julia and Dynasty, has died aged 84.

Carroll’s daughter, Suzanne Kay, confirmed her mother died Friday (4 October) in Los Angeles of cancer.

In a statement, Suzanne said: ‘Carroll was a consummate entertainer and beloved icon whose career spanned nearly seven decades.

‘She paved the way for many and never allowed anyone to limit or define her.’

The actress earned a Tony Award for best actress for the musical No Strings in 1962, and also earned an Oscar nomination for he role in Claudine in 1975.

Her most noted role was perhaps as Julia Baker on TV series Julia, where she played a nurse whose husband had been killed in Vietnam on the sitcom from 1968 to 1971.

Diahann Carroll in Julia (Picture: 20th Century Fox Tv/Kobal/REX)

Diahann Carroll made history as the first black woman to win a Tony Award (Picture: 20th Century Fox Tv/Kobal/REX)

She became noted as the first black woman to star in a TV show where the role wasn’t a stereotypical servant, with the first ever being Ethel Waters as a maid in 1950s series Beulah.

The actress also played Dominique Deveraux on soap Dynasty during the 1980s, and starred in the likes of Carmen Jones and Porgy and Bess.

Director Ava DuVernay has paid tribute on Twitter, writing: ‘Diahann Carroll walked this earth for 84 years and broke ground with every footstep. One of the all-time greats.

‘She blazed trails through dense forests and elegantly left diamonds along the path for the rest of us to follow. Extraordinary life. Thank you, Ms. Carroll.’

Carroll is survived by her daughter Suzanne and grandchildren, August and Sydney.
